IAAF World Women's Road Race Championships (defunct)

This competition for women only was replaced by the IAAF World Half Marathon Championship in 1992. The race distance was 15 km, except in 1983 and 1984 only 10 km. The team ranking is calculated by adding the positions of the top 3 runners, except in 1984 by adding the times of the top 3 runners.

1. 1983, Dec 04 San Diego USA 2. 1984, Nov 11 Madrid ESP 3. 1985, Nov 03 Gateshead GBR 4. 1986, Nov 09 Lisboa POR 5. 1987, Nov 21 Monte Carlo MON 6. 1988, Mar 20 Adelaide AUS 7. 1989, Sep 24 Rio de Janeiro BRA 8. 1990, Oct 14 Dublin IRL 9. 1991, Oct 13 Nieuwegein NED

IAAF World Road Relay Championships (defunct)

A relay of six runners competed over the classic marathon distance of 42,195 km. The length of the legs varies of 5 km - 10 km - 5 km - 10 km - 5 km - 7,195 km. In 1986 at the predecessor World Challenge Road Relay, the men's competition was different: Five runners had to cover a leg of 12,195 km each.

1986, Nov 30 Hiroshima JPN 1. 1992, May 09-10 Funchal POR 2. 1994, Apr 16-17 Litochoro GRE 3. 1996, Apr 13-14 København DEN 4. 1998, Apr 18-19 Manaus BRA

World Athletics Race Walking Team Championships

1961 - 1985, the competition started with a qualifying round, since then there is only the final round. In the beginning, the team ranking was calculated by adding the position points of the top 3 finishers. Since 1999, the position of the top 3 of 5 starters is aggregated.

World Athletics Race Walking Tour

The walkers accumulate the best three results of the annually challenge races. The points are identically to the rank achieved in the specific race.

In 2007 - 2012, the challenge series ended with a final race of 10 km. All walkers could start, which had contested on three races at least during the season.

The World Athletics Race Walking Challenge was changed into the World Race Walking Tour in 2022.

Final race 1. 2007, Sep 29 Saransk RUS (20 km) 2. 2008, Sep 21 Murcia ESP (20 km) 3. 2009, Sep 19 Saransk RUS 4. 2010, Sep 18 Beijing CHN 5. 2011, Sep 17 La Coruña ESP 6. 2012, Sep 14 Erdos CHN 2013 - 2020 not held 2021, Jun 05 La Coruña ESP

In 2021 there was only one event in Race Walking Challenge due to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.
